FuncDef:
The protocol-tunnel vni command creates a VXLAN tunnel between the UP and CP.
The undo protocol-tunnel vni command deletes a VXLAN tunnel between the UP and CP.
By deafult, no VXLAN tunnel is created between the UP and CP.
CLIs: undo protocol-tunnel vni <vni-id> source <source-ip> destination <destination-ip> [ vpn-instance <vpn-name> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a VNI ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.

Specifies a source IP address for a VXLAN tunnel.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies a destination IP address for a VXLAN tunnel.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies a VPN instance name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31  case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Examples: [~HUAWEI-cu-controller-up1024-config-cu-agent] protocol-tunnel vni 10 source 1.1.1.1 destination 2.2.2.1 vpn-instance test
protocol-tunnel vni 10 source 1.1.1.1 destination 2.2.2.1 vpn-instance test
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To create a VXLAN tunnel between the and , run the protocol-tunnel vni command on the cp.
Precautions
VNI IDs must be set to the same value on the UP and CP.
